attributes.action: Conduct an urgent review of the Immigration Acts 2014 and 2016
attributes.background: I request an urgent review of the legislation in the Immigration Acts 2014 and 2016 (‘the Acts’), in view of the recent adverse publicity over the “Windrush” generation citizens of the UK and colonies, who are  reported to have suffered alleged violations of their civil liberties and human rights.
attributes.additional_details: As a consequence of the implementation of the Acts, several UK/EU citizens of the "Windrush" generation have suffered loss of:- indefinite leave to remain, employment, housing, health care, bank accounts, driving licences, freedom of movement in EU states, and have experienced detention or threats of detention, and deportation/removal from the UK.

attributes.action: Revise and implement strategies to improve the quality of life for care leavers
attributes.background:
From foster care to independence, the support care leavers receive is automatically reduced, and their voice is no longer heard. This makes it increasingly difficult for care leavers to progress into adulthood, compared to young people who grew up with their birth parents. 

This needs to change.

attributes.action: Impose sanctions on USA for removing children from immigrant parents at borders
attributes.background: America is currently removing children from their immigrant parents at borders, and placing them alone in detention centres. Its also come to light that they have since 'lost' track of over 1500 children.. the these children have simply disappeared.

attributes.action: Order for a new and updated Family Justice Review Report to be completed.
attributes.background: The last Family Justice Review was filled in November 2011. Almost 7 years ago. A new Family Justice Review is long overdue and a new updated report should be conducted to further improve the Family Justice System.
attributes.additional_details: The last and Final Family Justice Review Report was completed by Mr Norgove in November 2011. The government should now consider a new and updated Family Justice Review Report to be completed. There are many changes and improvements that could be discussed for instance; Fathers are not granted automatic parental responsibility like mothers are. The impact of Parental Alienation abuse and how the Justice system intends to address this. Further ways to encourage and facilitate contact for children

attributes.action: Close the financial support gap for students taking a leave of absence
attributes.background: We call for the Department of Work and Pensions, in line with the policy of Student Finance England, to recognise students taking a leave of absence as no longer full-time students, and thus eligible to claim benefits including Housing Benefit, Income Support, JSA, and ESA and Universal Credit.
attributes.additional_details:
Students on a leave of absence are not considered to be full-time students by SFE, so their loan and maintenance payments stop. The DWP class these students as full-time and thus not eligible for state benefits. 

Students require leave for many reasons, such as illness, disability, bereavement, care duties, pregnancy and parental leave. Current rules place these students in a vulnerable position whereby they may have access to no support at all, pressuring them to drop out of their degrees.

attributes.action: Scrap the 25% overseas transfer charge expats pay on QROPS pensions
attributes.background: Expats pay the charge on moving pensions from the UK to a QROPS or between QROPS unless they live in Europe or one of 13 countries which have QROPS outside Europe, which is unfair to the thousands who cannot access a QROPS pension where they live
attributes.additional_details: The overseas transfer charge discriminates against expats outside the EEA in a country which does not host a QROPS, making them pay a 25% exit tax on moving their pension fund from the UK to a QROPS to gain better financial terms. The charge is unreasonable as the rules punish QROPS members for financial planning when savers with other pensions, like Self-Invested Personal Pensions (SIPPs), can live in the same place as a QROPS saver and suffer no transfer charge on moving their fund

attributes.action: Introduce domestic abuse awareness as part of life skills to the curriculum
attributes.background: On 21.01.2018 an innocent child lost her life to domestic abuse.  The term "domestic incident" was used, minimising the severity of domestic abuse, indicating that there is a lack of understanding of the complex cycle.  Without awareness of this crime, how are we able to protect our young people?
attributes.additional_details:
My name is Samantha Billingham and I am a survivor of domestic abuse.

It is easier to stop something happening in the first place than to repair the damage after it has happened and with mandatory awareness, we can do that.  The outcome of talking about domestic abuse will have a positive behaviour enabling our young people to deal effectively with the challenges that domestic abuse brings to life.

Awareness is powerful, it gives people choices, options, knowledge, which could just save a life.

attributes.action: Remove chargeable road tax for UK vehicles over 30 years old
attributes.background:
Currently as it stands the total value of road tax paid on my classic car since new now out-values the value of the car itself today ! and also may be higher than the original RRP of the vehicle in 1986.
I hereby request to open a petition to remove chargeable road tax on vehicles over 30 years old

attributes.action: Require train seats in new trains to be more comfortable
attributes.background: The Government must undertake an urgent reassessment of the comfort of seating in new trains, including services between England and Scotland.  It must require the relevant rolling stock companies to refurbish seats to improve passenger comfort, within the confines of current EU standards.
attributes.additional_details:
Already influential voices within the Rail industry are expressing concern at the new seats. At a time the Government is urging people to reduce carbon footprints and use alternatives to cars, whereas seats on buses are getting more sumptuous and comfortable, seats on new trains are far less welcoming and comfortable than they were 50 years ago.

It's not too late to pressurise the Government to change the seats, the cost will be absorbed by those passengers who don't desert the railway for good.

attributes.action: Bring back the death penalty in the UK
attributes.background: Is it fair and just that someone who takes a life and is of sound body and mind is allowed to carry on living albeit incarcerated in one of HM prisons, and in due time being released by nature of serving their sentence or early parole .
attributes.additional_details: If the death Penalty was to be reintroduced in the UK. it would surely bring down knife and gun crime and make people think twice before committing premeditated or random attacks on innocent members of the public

attributes.action: Incorporate LGBT+ history in primary and secondary school education
attributes.background: By introducing education of LGBT+ history, promoting LGBT+ equality and diversity and the normalisation of same-sex relationships in primary and secondary schools, we can work with children across the UK to help fight and prevent discriminating, and encouraging acceptance in future generations.

attributes.action: Remove fees for basic RGN nurse training and teach them in nursing schools.
attributes.background:
The NHS is unable to recruit sufficient nurses and many potential nurses are put off by university / diploma debts. 
Increase the student nurse uptake by paying a basic salary and contract them to work for the trust that trained them for 6 months once qualified.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the schools of nursing were removed from our teaching hospitals the number of people coming into nursing has declined. In 1990 student nurses made up a THIRD of the NHS workforce, once Project 2000 was introduced the quality and number of student nurses steadily slipped.
Nursing at degree level entry means the NHS has lost thousands of potentially fabulous nurses because those that want to nurse cannot afford to train. 
We need excellent basic nursing care skills before we need a degree!

attributes.action: Abolition of the coarse fishing closed season on rivers (16th March-16th June)
attributes.background: This outdated law has left us Angler’s twiddling our thumbs for years, there is no evidence to prove all year round fishing harms fish’s breeding habits, no effects have been seen on commercial fisheries and canals which have had no closed season for years.
attributes.additional_details: We have also seen the loss of Tackle & bait shops for years during the closed season as takings reduce massively, fishing seems to be a dying hobby which is a crying shame as kids and adults alike could do with more outside pastimes not less. More fishing time and longer evenings (in closed season) can give the sport and local businesses a real boost and give more opportunities for people to take up Angling.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of the devastating effects of Coercive Behaviour.
attributes.background: Victims of Coercive Behaviour are mentally, emotionally and financially abused. The Government must fund a campaign to raise awareness of the effects of coercive behaviour. Police, health care workers, lawyers and others who may meet victims of coercive behaviour also need training.
attributes.additional_details: I reported my abuser to the police, my doctor, a lawyer and nothing was done. More awareness and training is needed to protect men and women and children. They are usually too scared to make a report to the police for fear of being ridiculed. This is a major crime with devastating effects and victims need to be taken seriously. I was totally humiliated by my abuser over several years, my mental condition and self-worth was at rock bottom.

attributes.action: Introduce a new Act of Parliament to protect freedom of religion and belief.
attributes.background: Freedom of religion and belief in the UK is under attack. It is time for a new generation to rise up and reclaim this great heritage of religious freedom and for the UK Parliament to pass a new Act affirming our religious freedom.
attributes.additional_details: The UK led the world in developing freedom of religion, and in spreading the idea of religious freedom around the world. Today, that heritage is being turned upside down and we are turning our backs on our history. We are seeing an increasingly intolerant secular humanism and anti-Christian prejudice, often called Christianophobia, in the UK. We need to tackle this violence and prejudice towards practising Christians in the UK.

attributes.action: Rebuild the “Hereford, Hay and Brecon” and “Mid-Wales” railways
attributes.background: The Beeching cuts of the 1960s closed a significant number of lines in the Marches and mid-Wales, the return of which would boost the economy and vitality of the area. There would also be a potential reduction in road traffic and therefore of carbon emissions.

attributes.action: The House of Lords may be in need of reform, but must not be abolished.
attributes.background: Given the power structures in Britain, its electoral system, and the lack of a head of state who can exercise oversight, a unicameral parliament would be a disaster.
attributes.additional_details:
Unelected as they are, they're still an essential part of the 3 pillars of State, in holding the executive to account.

The Lords has many experts in many fields.... to be an MP or part of the executive, you need NO qualifications, even to hold one of the great offices of State.... maybe the old school tie perhaps.

Unelected they do not fall foul of the virus that is populism which is what led to the rise of fascism in the 1930's

They are thus indispensable.

attributes.action: Grant student mothers the same protections as working mothers
attributes.background: Higher education institutions are required under employment law to make maternity provisions for working mothers, yet there is no legal requirement ensuring the same protections for students who are mothers. This blind-spot has led to student mothers facing avoidable adversity in higher education.
attributes.additional_details:
In spite of the Equality Act 2010,  the rights of student mothers are primarily determined at their institution's discretion. Student mothers are easily marginalised and often squeezed out of the education system as a result.

Access to flexible working, maternity leave and breastfeeding facilities are examples of legal entitlements held by workers. There is no reason for student mothers not to be equally protected, when they are just as vulnerable to maternity discrimination. This must change.

attributes.action: Bring Oliver Robbins before the European Scrutiny Committee.
attributes.background: Mr Robbins has a key role in the negotiations for exiting the EU. He is a public servant and as such is answerable for actions that he has taken.
attributes.additional_details: In PMQs on 2nd May 2018, the Chair of the ESC asked the Prime Minister to request the presence of Ollie Robbins to answer questions for the Committee. He commented that Mr Robbins has been asked at least 3 times. It is unacceptable, when he is so involved in the negotiations, that he has shown such disregard to the Committee and the electorate.

attributes.action: Bring the deadline to eliminate plastic by 2042 forward
attributes.background: Our planet is being consumed by plastic. It is a major crisis. Plastic has taken thousands lives of sea wildlife. By 2050 there is going to be more plastic in the sea than fish. 2042 is too late for us! We're children. We can't do anything about the production of plastic but you can.
attributes.additional_details:
Your deadline is too late for our generation. Not only does plastic waste ruin our fragile, beautiful environment, it is becoming harmful to our health. Companies use plastic. They need to be more culpable for the amount of unnecessary plastic being produced. This can be enforced by the government as you can change polices to prevent this or heavily tax companies that produce excess plastic. Please consider our words.

Yours hopefully, Year 6 Sandgate Primary School
attributes.creator_name: Miss Catherine Thomas (on behalf of Year 6 at Sandgate Primary School)

attributes.action: Change religious slaughter law to mirror the licensing requirements in Germany
attributes.background: Change the laws to mirror those in Germany as outlined in House of Commons Library SN07108SES dated 18/02/2015. Germany requires licensing and the matching of volumes produced to actual needs for religious slaughtered products.Britain has no such defined requirement for monitoring or enforcement
attributes.additional_details:
House of Commons SN07108 dated 28/02/2015
DEFRA T02017 and RFI 9592
Volume of meat produced by religious slaughter over 50%
Religious groups requiring such produce 6%
Most meat on sale in UK supermarkets carry EEC codes that refer to establishments that practice religious slaughter but there is no requirement to restrict the sale or even label these products which denies british consumers choice and infringes on the religious freedoms of groups who religions forbid its use

attributes.action: Amend the law so Chartered Legal Executives can certify Powers of Attorney
attributes.background: At present we cannot certify General or Lasting Powers of Attorney under existing legislation despite the fact that we can apply to run our own legal practices or be a Judge. It causes confusion for clients and we are having to rely on the goodwill of Solicitor colleagues to assist certifying copies

attributes.action: Ban low letterboxes in UK on new build
attributes.background: I would like to see the UK Government amend building regulations & ban low letterboxes as has been the case in Ireland Since January 1st 2001
attributes.additional_details:
Letter  boxes should be postman friendly..Low boxes can cause serious injury when you have quite a few in a row or on a round whilst carrying a sack of mail.
 Even just one low letterbox is one too many.. You wouldn't put the keyhole down there so why put the letterbox down there.

attributes.action: Fund the dualling of the A120 from Hare Green to Harwich
attributes.background: There is an agreement in place for the stretch of the A120 to be dualled with funding from Hutchison Ports as part of planning permission for a container port at Bathside Bay, Harwich. But this has been delayed for years and the town cannot wait any longer - the road needs to be dualled now.
attributes.additional_details: With an ever increasing population and more lorries using Harwich International Port the road is under strain. It is also in need of complete relaying as the concrete slabs it was laid on are at the end of their lifespan. The road should be dualled now rather than relaying it as a single carriageway. Better road access is hoped to bring economic growth to Tendring, which has some of the most deprived wards in the country. It is also home to a major UK port - a gateway to Europe.

attributes.action: Ban Standing Charges on all Energy and Water Bills
attributes.background:
Standing Charges on Gas, Electricity and Water, bills are an unfair charge, and have no real basis on the amount of Energy or water used.
The standing charge is just another way for the Energy and Water Companies to unjustly increase their profits.
attributes.additional_details:
SSE charge £24.53 plus 5% VAT =  £26.98 on both Gas and Electricity,
For a dual fuel set up that adds £53.98 per quarter to the consumers bill, absolutely no real justification for this type of rip off.

attributes.action: Create a UK Register for  people convicted of Animal Cruelty, Abuse & Neglect
attributes.background: Please sign in support of a 'UK Animal Offenders Register', a central database which will consist of name, address and convictions of people who have been convicted of any form of animal cruelty and abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
The Public and Breeders / sellers of animals will be able  to check this central database. If it is found that someone who has been convicted of animal cruelty or abuse has a animal the supplier / breeder will be held liable and prosecuted. 
At the moment there is no law to stop anyone who has been convicted of animal cruelty doing this again elsewhere.
Stricter laws need to be implemented to help protect animals, heavier fines & longer prison sentences as well as a Animal Offenders Register.

attributes.action: All NHS hospitals should provide vegan meals including dairy free spread & milk
attributes.background: 7% of the uk population are vegan and many have had very poor experiences of being a patient and not having any food to eat. Plant based diets are beneficial to good health and prevent many illnesses including types of cancer.

attributes.action: Reduce the age of the meningitis Acwy vaccine to 3months
attributes.background: In November 2017 we lost our 10 month old daughter to meningitis W which is something no one gets a vaccine against until they are roughly 14. The only way to get this vaccine is to pay privately, which can cost about £200.
attributes.additional_details:
If this vaccine had been available maybe my little Lily would still be with all her family today. I don’t know what else to do other than try and look at getting the age reduced to try and prevent this happening to any other people. All please sign and share. There is probably plenty of other petitions going around for this but the more there is we stand more of a chance 
Thank you

attributes.action: Make St. George's Day, 23rd April, a Public Holiday
attributes.background: St. Patrick's Day is a public holiday in Northern Ireland, why shouldn't the English celebrate their Patron Saint's Day with a Public Holiday?

attributes.action: I want to create a law to neuter domestic cats except for registered breeders.
attributes.background:
Animal shelters are always full of unwanted or abandoned cats.   I cannot understand why you wouldn't care for your sentient family member. 
Hypothetically, one unneutered female could be responsible for over 20,000 descendants in five years
attributes.additional_details:
Facts and Figures via Cats Protection	
Estimations of one to two million stray cats.
•	Over 150,000 stray and abandoned cats enter shelter care in the UK every year
•	In 2016 we helped around 500 cats a day
•	Cats Protection rehomed 43,000 cats in 2016
•	Cats Protection reunited 3,000 cats with their owners in 2016
In 2016 CP trapped, neutered and returned 20,000 feral cats.
CP runs the largest single species neutering programme in the world.

Lack of Money is no excuse - help is available
CP can help with the cost of neutering and micro-chipping if you receive State Benefits or are on a low income.  The RSPCA also have a voucher scheme.

attributes.action: Issue statement on the draft Directive on copyright in the Digital Single Market
attributes.background: Proposal for a Directive of the European Parliament and of the Council on copyright in the Digital Single Market in its current shape will severly impact the economic freedom and freedom of speech of all EU citizens if implemented. It favours big companies and research institutes over individuals.

attributes.action: Reinstate the old train timetable for Southern, Thameslink and Southeastern rail
attributes.background: On May 20 2018 the rail industry made the biggest changes to train times in a generation.  For the first three days of the new time table the operators could not run a full service or trains on time. There is too much pressure on key stations which continually will result in delays and disruption.
attributes.additional_details: There is countless news stories regarding this and the only option to resume a some what decent service is to reinstate the old timetable and take the pressure off key stations.

attributes.action: Bringing back a direct train service from London to Grimsby Return.
attributes.background:
For many years we have had to deal with the loss of business from Grimsby, the big blow was the loss of our direct connection to London via train.

I am starting this petition because I want to see the now publicly owned ECRL extend their London to Lincoln service to Grimsby or Cleethorpes.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a regular service which is run from London Kings Cross to Lincoln daily. It takes 1.55hrs from London to Lincoln. To get to Grimsby from Lincoln, it would take around an extra 20 -30mins directly. 

This would be overall a journey time of 2.30hrs - 2.40hrs from London to Grimsby. 

Grimsby is a great town and always has been. A huge amount of grimbrians have moved to london for work and have family still in Grimsby, more importantly it would bring much needed businesses to the area!

attributes.action: Create an independent body that holds the PHSO to account
attributes.background: The Parliamentary and Health Service Ombudsman investigates serious complaints against the NHS. I made a complaint about my son Cody's death, which I believe was caused by failures in his care in hospital. But they didn't uphold my complaint, and there's no way for me to appeal their decision.
attributes.additional_details: There should be an independent body that checks whether the PHSO has done a proper investigation and considered all the evidence. This should be overseen by the Secretary of State for Health, so that there is democratic accountability. An independent investigation would give people reassurance and could help them get to the truth about what happened to their loved ones.

attributes.action: Rehouse our brave Armed Forces as a matter of priority
attributes.background: Veterans are supposed to have “priority” from Local authorities when it comes to affordable housing and health care under the Armed Forces Covenant but all too often this does not happen.
attributes.additional_details:
Estimates taken from charities Shelter and Crisis show almost 8,000 military heroes are currently homeless.  However, the Government does not keep accurate records. We believe that the Government should act as a matter of urgency and help our brave Armed Forces heroes in their hour of need. 
Rehouse our brave Armed Forces as a matter of urgency.
They have served our country. Now it is time for us to repay that debt.

attributes.action: Light beacons across the country on March 29th 2019 to celebrate Brexit
attributes.background:
At 11pm on March 29th 2019 our country will leave the EU.
To celebrate this historic and momentous occasion, we believe the Government should arrange for beacons to be lit from Lands End to John O'Groats and at all points in between.
attributes.additional_details:
After over 40 years of Brussels rule, we are finally leaving the EU.
Lighting beacons around the country would be a symbolic gesture celebrating our independence and sovereignty.

attributes.action: Ban the use of all non-recyclable packaging materials by 31st December 2020.
attributes.background:
It's crazy that we are still buying products with mixed packaging materials where part of it is recyclable and part of it not. 
I believe this means we recycle significantly less than we could as some people do not bother to sort it and just throw everything into the general rubbish.
attributes.additional_details: The need to reduce the use of landfill and to increase recycling is widely accepted and I believe this would be a major step forward to making a greener more sustainable future for our country and the world

attributes.action: Stiffer sentencing and more resources for the police to prioritise tool theft.
attributes.background: Tool theft is on the increase and has widespread and serious broad reaching consequences for victims and their dependents. Current legislation and policing is in effective and the consequences result in loss of income and loss of jobs for those who often can least afford it.
attributes.additional_details:
Social media is currently full of reports of theft from vehicles and business premises where the police are unable or unwilling to pursue the offenders.
These thefts result in serious financial difficulties for trades and businesses which often result in lost earnings and even job losses and closure of the business. Many businesses are at breaking point and potentially will start taking the law into their own hands which is entirely unacceptable but Increasingly likely.

attributes.action: Reduce the age of bowel cancer screening in England to 50.
attributes.background: My wife died aged 56 of secondary cancer after being diagnosed with bowel cancer. One of the consultants informed us the tumour had probably been present for 6 to 8 years. Had she been screened at 50 I believe she would still be alive and the NHS saved tens of thousands of pounds.
attributes.additional_details: Cancer Research UK

attributes.action: Make Philip Hammonds Brexit Preperation Fund the NHS Fund instead.
attributes.background:
Philip Hammond said in his Autumn 2017 Budget: 
“We have already invested almost £700 million in Brexit preparations, today I am setting aside over the next two years another £3 billion. And I stand ready to allocate further sums if and when needed”.

Let’s Fund our NHS Instead!

attributes.action: Compulsary Subsidised Swimming Lessons for Children (ages 3-10 years) in the UK.
attributes.background:
Compulsory Swimming Lessons for Children up to the age of 10 in the UK is paramount in fighting the UK’s battle against accidental drownings.
“Taking part in in formal swimming lessons reduces the risk of drowning among children aged 1 to 4 years” (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, 2016)
attributes.additional_details:
Latest figures from the National Water Safety Forum (NWSF) show that 300 people died in accidental drownings in the UK last year.
The number of people aged 19 and under who drowned in the UK has risen by 25 per cent (Local Government Association 2017, National Water Safety, 2017)
Water Safety and Rescue Techniques combined with taught sessions will reduce the rate of accidental deaths due to drowning, and promote a deeper understanding at an early age of the risks associsated with Water Safety

attributes.action: Changes to Children Act 1989
attributes.background: Urgent action is required to give more rights & protection to parents/carers & also vulnerable children in care
attributes.additional_details:
Sections 20 & 31 of Children Act are currently unworkable, resulting in a care crisis. We call on government to take urgent action to make changes to legislation & guidance to protect the parenting/caring role from a distance by:
A more humane ethical family centred approach where birth & adoptive parents & special guardians can be seen as part of the solution & not part of the problem, in striving to do their best caring for their children.
Safeguarding vulnerable children with new legislation & legal frameworks that also supports parents/carers when children are 'beyond parental control' which may be related to poor mental health, disabilities, early life trauma, abuse or neglect.

attributes.action: Produce statutory guidance on how universities should support Dyslexic students.
attributes.background: Dyslexics learn differently. They are put at a disadvantage in today's educational system. Dyslexics should be given the same opportunity to reach their potential.
attributes.additional_details: I am dyslexic. I was lucky enough to receive a lot of support throughout my education. However, when I started university, my dyslexia became more apparent. I found it very difficult to learn from the teaching style. Moreover, the majority of my work was not marked in conjunction with my SPLD cover note. After speaking to my dyslexia help tutor, I learned that many lecturers do not believe in dyslexia. Therefore, the government should introduce statutory guidance to universities on how they can support dyslexic students. For example, by recommending compulsory seminars/training for staff.

attributes.action: Allow all children in school term times a leave allowance for family hoildays.
attributes.background:
I am unable to take leave in term times due to the loss of earnings being self employed and the inflated prices travel operators charge. This makes it impossible for normal working people to afford a family holiday. 
We ask for the government to discuss allowing at least 7 days a year for this.
attributes.additional_details: It is a known fact that during our childrens term times average holiday's increase by hundreds if not thousands. This has been an ongoing issue that the government have never really addressed to benefit parents. The impact on working class and self employed often means we are unable to have family hoilday's due to the inflated prices. Enabling a small amount of leave days per year, will benefit all children from a family point of view as well as a educational point of view. Thank you.

attributes.action: Mandatory training for Police and DV Agencies about DV Issues in BME Communities
attributes.background: In 2014 a mother and her baby daughter died as a result of a vicious attack by an ex-partner/the child's father. A Domestic Homicide Review report found that police made many mistakes which contributed to their deaths. Research has shown that African heritage people are less likely to report abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Issues undeniably ours such as reduced likelihood of equal treatment, inappropriate reference points, increased likelihood of not being believed or taken seriously, repeated need to explain our cultural norms and language which result in us constantly educating and consoling others before we receive support.

attributes.action: To withdraw the invitation extended to Donald Trump of a state visit to the UK
attributes.background: In light of the current US administration's withdrawal from the JCPOA the appropriateness of a UK state visit must be reassessed. The actions of Donald Trump threaten both global security and to undermine global cooperation on all fronts. A state visit sends a message of solidarity not condemnation.

attributes.action: Mandatory annual testing of Agricultural Trailers with a capacity of 10 tonnes +
attributes.background: Since the death of Harry, 19, due to faulty trailer brakes as a harvest worker, we call for mandatory annual trailer maintenance by qualified mechanics. Currently there is no road test for agricultural trailers, leading to many deaths by poorly adjusted and poorly maintained trailers.
attributes.additional_details: The law needs to be changed to impose the mandatory testing of agricultural trailers that can carry a load of ten tonne or over. A professional mechanic should award an approved certificate when the required standard of maintenance has been reached. It should be a criminal offence for anyone not to have a certificate. This will create a policeable system of road safety that protects the operator and other road users.

attributes.action: Make a fair, set amount of maintenance per child and not 25% of income!
attributes.background: Non resident parents (NRP's) are paying far too much to the resident parent of their child/children. This is causing severe depression and suicidal tendencies in NRP's. NRP's have to try and provide for their families at home whilst paying out a huge 25% plus of their income to their ex partners.
attributes.additional_details: The government decide how much an adult requires to live on so people on jobseekers allowance receive the same amount from one person to the next. Why is it the more a working NRP earns the more they have to pay the other parent? Why does the child suddenly require more money because the NRP has got a better job or worked overtime. NRP's often work extra hours to try and compensate for CMS/CSA payments and then they are required to pay the other parent more because their income has increased?

attributes.action: Remove the tax relief enjoyed by landlords investing in Buy-to-Let property.
attributes.background:
Currently landlords in the UK can claim tax relief on their interest payments. Ordinary homeowners are not able to do this. Tenants are not able to claim tax relief on their rent. 

This is grossly unfair and has distorted the housing market.
attributes.additional_details:
Although the tax relief for higher rate taxpayers is currently being phased out by the "Section 24" of the Finance Act 2015, landlords are still able to enjoy tax relief at the basic rate. This is still unfair and puts first time buyers at a disadvantage. 

I cannot get tax relief on the interest to borrow money and invest in the stock market, or to buy my first home. Why should buy to let property be any different?

attributes.action: Look at the stats for adopted children failing in education and reasons why
attributes.background: Having been a foster carer, now a parent of two adopted children and working in education, I have decided to speak out for all those families who live with the reality that adoption can bring for their children and education. The statistics for adopted children failing in education are unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
Once a child is adopted the trauma some of them have faced does not suddenly disappear and the support they require needs to be accessible for them especially in education and I believe this starts with training for all staff in schools and nurseries. 
Failing in education due to lack of understanding of an adopted childs needs is unacceptable and I want the government to have to answer to why the statistics are so high.
